author: Bindu Shajan Perappadan
text:
Well-known cartoonist Sudhir Tailang, who was suffering from a brain tumour, passed away on Saturday, at his home in Mayur Vihar here, surrounded by his family members. The artist was 55 and had been under treatment for over two years.

His family said that the cartoonist breathed his last at 12.30 p.m. and is to be cremated at 2 p.m. on Sunday at Lodhi Road crematorium.

Doctors at Medanta Hospital in Gurgaon, where he died, said: “Tailang was under treatment for the last two years. He was in hospital for more than a month before he was discharged and his family told that chances of his recovery weren't bright.”

He was awarded Padma Shri in 2004 for his contribution to the art of cartooning.
title: Cartoonist Sudhir Tailang passes away
